news.title: CHI apologises after death of Dublin teen with severe asthma who waited four years to see consultant ruled medical misadventure
news.summary: Children’s Health Ireland has issued a “sincere apology” for shortcomings in the care of a Dublin teenager with severe and poorly controlled asthma who died following a severe attack while waiting over four years to see a specialist consultant.

news.title: Alleged victim in 'branding stamp' trial fails to appear in court for second time
news.summary: The alleged victim in the trial of four men accused of producing a "branding stamp", an axe and a steel bar while assaulting and falsely imprisoning him in a Dublin house, failed to turn up in court for a second time this week.

news.title: Eoin McGee answers: ‘I have saved over €10,000 for my grandchildren, where should I store it to earn the most interest?’
At least 36 dead and more than 270 ‘unaccounted for’ after huge fire at Hong Kong high-rise residential complex
news.summary: The death toll from a massive fire that ripped through multiple high-rise residential blocks in Hong Kong's northern Tai Po district has risen to 36, the city's leader John Lee said early on Thursday.

news.title: Explainer: What are the new rules around immigration that are set to be introduced?
news.summary: The Government has announced changes to aspects of Ireland’s immigration system, which will tighten rules around things such as citizenship and family reunification for non-EEA members.

news.title: Man who held teen ‘hostage’ by threatening to leak naked photos of her online after meeting on Roblox is jailed
news.summary: A man who held a 15-year-old girl “hostage” by threatening to leak naked photographs of her, having met the child through an online game, has been jailed for two and half years.

news.title: The 2 Johnnies approached gardaí about officers for recruitment podcast, but didn’t seek payment
news.summary: Comedy duo The 2 Johnnies approached An Garda Síochána about featuring on a recruitment podcast but never sought a cent from them.

news.title: How Jessie Buckley and Paul Mescal unlocked the emotional power of ‘Hamnet’
news.summary: During the emotionally wrecking final scene of  Hamnet , Jessie Buckley and Paul Mescal had an issue.

news.title: Eilis O’Hanlon: Where the BBC has fallen down most dramatically and why RTÉ’s Prime Time segment on homelessness made us all sit up
news.summary: One of the biggest ­disappointments about the recent ­revelations of ­institutional bias at the BBC was the realisation that the ­corporation has become ­impossible to defend.

news.title: ‘God Save the King’ anthem played before Ireland’s U-19 qualifier against Sweden in Bulgaria
news.summary: Match organisers in Bulgaria were left red-faced after playing God Save the King for Ireland’s U-19s earlier today, before they took on Sweden in a Women’s European qualifier.
